uk.ac.cf.cs.scm5mjw.mda.devices
Class InformationSource

java.lang.Object
  uk.ac.cf.cs.scm5mjw.mda.devices.AbstractWirelessDevice
      uk.ac.cf.cs.scm5mjw.mda.devices.InformationSource

public final class InformationSource
extends AbstractWirelessDevice

This is a class which represents an information source in the mobile communications system.
An information source reports on a particular resource. (An instance of a report at a given time is called an artifact.) A resource ID is used to indicate the resource an information source reports on.

Notes on units:
* n/a

getArtifactContainer

public ArtifactContainer getArtifactContainer()
This method overrides the corresponding AbstractWirelessDevice method.
This method will throw an error if called - Information sources do NOT maintain an artifact container (they simply generate artifacts).

Overrides:
getArtifactContainer in class AbstractWirelessDevice

commitArtifacts

public java.util.List<Artifact> commitArtifacts()
This method will override the original commArtifacts().
An information source will never add any artifacts to itself, thus this method is implemented so that it will do NOTHING (nothing is actually committed!).
Aside from the fact that it will not actually add any artifacts (i.e. it will not commit any artifacts), it does the same things as the original commtArtifacts.

Also note that it will still return whatever list of artifacts was specified to be added in the communication initiation. This SHOULD be an empty list!!!

Overrides:
commitArtifacts in class AbstractWirelessDevice

setTransmissionPhase

public void setTransmissionPhase(double duration,
                                 java.util.List<Artifact> artifactsToAdd)
This method overrides the original setTransmissionPhase method with an additional check to ensure that the artifactsToAdd is an empty list (this is a requirement of an information source).
Aside from this, this method is identical to the original (in fact, it calls the original after performing the check).

Overrides:
setTransmissionPhase in class AbstractWirelessDevice
See Also:
AbstractWirelessDevice.unsetCommunicationAttributes()
